intro: Dalea barrancae, commonly known as the barranca Dalea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, showy pink to red flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. It is a perennial herb that produces pod-like fruits containing several seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
